thread.title: Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels
thread.title_full: Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels

title: Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels
text:
CBS Shows Online Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez). Texas Rangers' Adrian Beltre points to the dugout whiles standing on second after hitting a bases learning double off of Los Angeles Angels' Andrew Heaney in the fifth inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arli... (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez). Texas Rangers starting pitcher Derek Holland delivers to the Los Angeles Angels in the first inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez). Los Angeles Angels' Albert Pujols follows through on a double to center off a pitch from Texas Rangers' Derek Holland in the second inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez). Los Angeles Angels starting pitcher Andrew Heaney works against the Texas Rangers in the first inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez). Texas Rangers left fielder Josh Hamilton (32) reaches up to grab a sacrifice fly by Los Angeles Angels' Shane Victorino in the second inning of a baseball game that scored Albert Pujols Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, T... By SCHUYLER DIXONAP Sports Writer 
ARLINGTON, Texas (AP) - The Texas Rangers clinched a wild-card spot and moved to the cusp of the AL West title, with Adrian Beltre's three-run double backing Derek Holland in a 5-3 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on Thursday night. 
The Rangers (87-72), in the playoffs for the first time since 2012 after a 95-loss season, are a win or a Houston loss away from their first division title since winning two straight and going to the World Series in 2010-11. 
The Angels can't defend their AL West championship, but still have a shot at the second wild card with three games left. Los Angeles (83-76) is a game behind the Astros and tied with Minnesota, which beat Cleveland 4-2. 
Holland (4-3) allowed three hits and three runs in 6 1-3 innings for his first win since Sept. 5. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
